result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Guerra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  Straight time.
Court allows defendant's probation orders, supervison, and work/treatment release monitoring to be transferred to Kenosha County if accepted.

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid over period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Complete a job training program  in order to enhance ability to obtain employment.  Seek and maintain full time employment.

Provide a DNA sample unless already done, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No contact with coactor Matthew Bittman.

Comply wth the standard rules of probation.
Restitution set at zero.
Cooperate and participate with an  AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED until 10/2/14 at 12:00 p.m.  Release privileges for employment and treatment purposes only.  
**If defendant fails to turn himself in to begin sentence on 10/2/14, Court orders defendant to begin serving  one (1) year HOC straight time FORTHWITH upon his apprenhension.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Guerra

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Defendant's pro se request to vacate DNA surcharge.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: as to the order filed 10-24-2014 correcting the Huber privileges times; signed and filed.  Faxed to Atty. Jason Baltz on this date.

Filed, signed Order.  

NOW, THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED: 
1.  That as long as the Huber privileges of the defendant are not revoked, the defendant, Michael Guerra, shall be allowed to cross state lines between the hours of 10 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. Monday through Saturday for the purposes of receiving his daily methadone treatment in Waukegon, Illinois. 
2.  That all other conditions and terms of the September 25, 2014 sentencing shall remain in place and full effect.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's motion to allow travel to Illinois (Waukegan) for methadone treatment daily.

Defendant Michael R Guerra in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 
Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, straight time, consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving. Credit for 4 days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE 60 DAYS "condition time" with release privileges for employment and treatment purposes only - STAYED until 10-02-2014 at 12:00 PM.
* No contact with the co-actor, Matthew Bittman.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless already done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Complete a job training program in order to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Seek and maintain full-time employment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* If defendant fails to turn himself in to begin serving the condition time on 10-02-2014 by 12:00 PM, court ORDERS defendant to begin serving the 1 year House of Correction time as straight time FORTHWITH upon his apprehension.
* Court set restitution at ZERO.
* Court ALLOWS defendant's probation orders, supervision, and work/treatment release monitoring to be transferred to Kenosha County, if accepted.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Sentencing Referral form.
Defendant's Character Witness Letter.

Defendant Michael R Guerra in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Michael R Guerra in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Joanne L. Hardtke for Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties not ready to proceed with a Plea Hearing today.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 09-25-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Michael R Guerra in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Joanne L. Hardtke for Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Projected Plea Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 08-19-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.
Court ordered the $1,000.00 signature bond REINSTATED.  Court "administratively" ordered the following conditions of release:  No contact with the victim.
for Michael R. Guerra.

Attorney Jason Baltz in court, defendant Michael R Guerra not in court, in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for Bail/Bond Hearing and Return on Warrant.

Defendant was picked up on this Court's outstanding bench warrant.

Atty. Mary Scholle is the attorney of record for the defendant.
Atty. Baltz submitted to the Court a proposed Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorneys.
Court ACCEPTS the proposed Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorneys.
Atty. Jason Baltz is now the attorney of record for the defendant.
Atty. Mary Scholle is "discharged" as the attorney of record for the defendant.

Court addressed bail:  Atty. Baltz advised the Court that the reason the defendant did not appear on the last court date is because the defendant was in custody at Kenosha County Jail on a P.O. hold.  Defense moves for reinstatement of the $1,000.00 signature bond.  No objections.  Court GRANTS defense's motion and ordered the $1,000.00 signature bond REINSTATED.  Court "administratively" ordered the following conditions of release:  No contact with the victim.

Court "administratively" CANCELLED the outstanding bench warrant.

Case adjourned to 07-14-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

FILED, signed Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorneys.
for Michael R. Guerra (DOB. 12-03-1977).  DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL.

Defendant Michael R Guerra NOT in court.  Attorney for the defendant, Mary Scholle, is currently in another court.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant does NOT appear.
State requests a bench warrant to issue on the defendant.
Court GRANTS request.
Court ORDERED a bench warrant to issue on the defendant.
**Defendant is to be remanded without bail.
Court ordered the $1,000.00 signature bond FORFEITED.
Court CANCELLED the 07-16-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, signed Arrest-Bench Warrant.

Defendant was denied acceptance into drug treatment court.

FILED, Pretrial Scheduling Order.

There is a drug treatment court referral pending.

Defendant Michael R Guerra in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court grants state's motion to orally amend the last paragraph on Page 1 of the Criminal Complaint to read, "12-16-13" rather than "12-6-13."  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-13-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael R Guerra in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
